info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 27 at 2:05AM EDT until June 27 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR CENTRAL CHESTER AND WEST CENTRAL MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... At 205 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Phoenixville, Coatesville, Downingtown, Collegeville, Royersford, Trappe, Lionville, Lionville-Marchwood, Glenmoore, Chester Springs, Pughtown, and Spring City. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 307 and 316. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
